actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from 20 to 10 years the length of time a divorced women's marriage to an insured individual must have lasted in order for her to qualify for wife's or widow's benefits on his wage record.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Reduces from 20 to 10 years the length of time a divorced woman's marriage to an individual insured under the Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance program of the Social Security Act must have lasted in order for her to qualify for wife's or widow's benefits on his wage record.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from 20 to 10 years the length of time a divorced women's marriage to an insured individual must have lasted in order for her to qualify for wife's or widow's benefits on his wage record.
